summary: I just realized that Dead Girl Walking from Heathers is literally Arya @ Gendry in 8x02 lol 💕, like she was on full Dead Girl...
question: I just realized that Dead Girl Walking from Heathers is literally Arya @ Gendry in 8x02 lol 💕, like she was on full Dead Girl Walking mode before she goes on a battle, what a queen 😂.
answer: Arya is a queen in her own right!!! Yet she’s on her own destination that’s for sure. She is definitely one of my faves.

summary: I’m -momentarily- back from the dead ! And I exhumed some old linearts I added color into.  In the books, Ned said that Arya...
caption:
I’m -momentarily- back from the dead ! And I exhumed some old linearts I added color into. 

In the books, Ned said that Arya looks a lot like Lyanna when she was young. So I drew a little side-by-side comparison of my headcanon of them (according to the books’ descriptions and the show’s haircut). I gave Arya paler hair and eyes since Catelyn has red hair and clear blue eyes. 

You can see the lines only under the cut :)

summary:
What’s interesting about Arya rejecting Gendry’s proposal scene isn’t that she turned it down because “I’m not a lady.”
Despite...
body:
What’s interesting about Arya rejecting Gendry’s proposal scene isn’t that she turned it down because “I’m not a lady.”

Despite some viewers seeing it as Arya not returning Gendry’s feelings (clearly, she’s in love with him, but that’s not the point I’m making), Arya rejected him because of what she felt being a wife represented. She didn’t reject him because it was just sex to her. She didn’t reject him because she didn’t love him. She didn’t reject him it was too soon.

Arya was flattered by his declaration of love and would’ve said yes if she were a lady (I mean, let’s just go with it because I have a lot of feelings the ‘I’m not a lady’).

Hell, she even kissed him back.

So, it’s just fascinating how some people try to frame the scene as if Gendry never had a chance because Arya didn’t return his feelings/wasn’t the marrying type.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Gendrya Foreshadowing: A Storm of Swords "Riverrun." Gendry put the hammer down and looked at her. "You look different now. Like...
body:
Gendrya Foreshadowing: A Storm of Swords

“Riverrun.” Gendry put the hammer down and looked at her. “You look different now. Like a proper little girl.”

“I look like an oak tree, with all these stupid acorns.”

“Nice though. A nice oak tree.” He stepped closer, and sniffed at her. “You even smell nice for a change.”

Okay, Gendry. We see you. You laughed at her at dinner with Lady Smallwood, but now you’re really looking at her and dare I say…becoming a bit smitten?

“You don’t. You stink.” Arya shoved him back against the anvil and made to run, but Gendry caught her arm. She stuck a foot between his legs and tripped him, but he yanked her down with him, and they rolled across the floor of the smithy. He was very strong, but she was quicker. Every time he tried to hold her still she wriggled free and punched him. Gendry only laughed at the blows, which made her mad. He finally caught both her wrists in one hand and started to tickle her with the other, so Arya slammed her knee between his legs. And wrenched free. Both of them were covered in dirt, and one sleeve was torn on her stupid acorn dress. “I bet I don’t look so nice now,” she shouted.

There’s a lot in this section. My first thought was that this chapter comes right on the heels of Jaime’s chapter in which he and Brienne have their epic sword fight. Many people liken that battle to a symbolic sex scene, as well as just one those moments that heightens a possible enemies to lovers trope. In this case with Arya and Gendry, it’s a toned down, ridiculously cute glimpse at what could be in their future. Gendry tickles her and wrestles with her, not out to hurt her in the least, but merely to tease. Arya truly attempts fighting back because at this point, she honestly thinks he’s laughing at her and being an annoying boy, and thus wants to prove herself and get away. There is nothing really violent here because they’re already friends, even if neither uses the word.

Secondly, I was struck by the line with her always managing to wriggle away. This reminds me of her actions in the show, that Arya always makes to go her own way. That perhaps each time in the future that Gendry goes to hang on, she might try and run or else dodge his advances as she doesn’t see herself as a lady.

And the KICKER of this scene. They return to the hall of Lady Smallwood and the band of Donddarion’s men they’ve both been travelling with, and the singer is singing this:

My featherbed is deep and soft,
And there I’ll lay you down,
I’ll dress you all in yellow silk,
And on your head a crown.
For you shall be my lady love,
And I shall be your lord.
I’ll always keep you warm and safe,
And guard you with my sword.

Who is Robert Baratheon’s kid? Who could ostensibly at some point provide a crown? Who could be made a lord as he was in the show and thus make Arya a lady? And we all know both of them would protect each other at any turn.  Also:  For you shall be my lady love/You can be m’lady OHMYGOD GENDRY.

And then the next part of the song:

And now she smiled and how she laughed,
The maiden of the tree.
She spun away and said to him
No featherbed for me.
I’ll wear a gown of golden leaves,
And bind my hair with grass.
But you can be my forest love,
And me your forest lass.

This part gives me minor anxiety in view of the ship, but I still think that Arya and Gendry are one of the pairing endgames in the books.  This verse makes me think of how the show ended, with their love a fleeting moment once it’s acted upon, and that Arya could ultimately leave (even if not over the whole damn ocean forever and ever because that’s dumb).

However, we could also view this part of the song as a nod to Arya never becoming a lady in the traditional sense.  That her and Gendry could still end up together, forsaking typical lord and lady roles.  Heck, Gendry could even throw away his tie to Robert and stay as he is, knowing he isn’t a lord just as much Arya isn’t a lady.  

This is just my analysis of Arya’s fourth(?) chapter in A Storm of Swords.  I’m on  a reread binge and my brain and heart are pricked for all the foreshadowing regarding ships and events and deaths and the like.  Fingers crossed for Gendrya!

blog.name: arianagrandes
blog.title: previously robbstark
blog.description: chaitali, tv shows and films, gif-maker. #userchaitali

summary: In a verse where Ramsay took Arya which is a dark sad place tbh. I can’t decide if Arya would have been able to save herself but...
question: In a verse where Ramsay took Arya which is a dark sad place tbh. I can’t decide if Arya would have been able to save herself but I think Ramsay might have been able  to get under her skin because that’s his talent. He would break her just hurt her. Imagine her finding her way to Jon after saving herself and Jon is so angry and protective and angsty. He sleeps beside her when she has nightmares and wipes away her tears when she cries.
answer:
I’m very grateful that Arya is “safe” in Braavos (I use safe very lightly here because I do think she’s in a very dangerous predicament). However, being Ramsay’s prisoner is possibly the most dangerous endgame for anyone in Westeros. 

I honestly don’t think Jon would be able to rest until he made sure that Ramsay Bolton was no longer breathing. Although, I see Arya being as equally ready to slit Ramsay’s throat at that point.

I have no doubt in my mind that there is no one book Jon Snow loves more in the world than Arya Stark.

blog.description: she/her | 20 | slytherin | intj

summary: Ya’ll realize how Gendry proposed to Arya right after the Hound basically told him he approved? So he literally proposed after...
body:
Ya’ll realize how Gendry proposed to Arya right after the Hound basically told him he approved? So he literally proposed after having her dad’s blessing.

And ya’ll realize how Arya lied underneath Gendry’s cloak after they had sex? So basically he metaphorically brought her under his protection, so they actually were already symbolically married right there?

And ya’ll realize how Gendry entered Winterfell on a white horse and the Hound on a black horse and when Arya went to KL she was riding a black horse and when she left, she was on a white horse?

And ya’ll realize how D&D fucked this all up just to sUbVerT exPeCtaTiOnS???

The starks: start the show getting seperated early on
The starks: end the show seperated after being together for like a...
body:
The starks: start the show getting seperated early on

The starks: end the show seperated after being together for like a month

Me: B-but…w-what about…the lone wolf dies but the pack survives?

D&D: sUbvErT eXpeCtaTiOnS

summary: Me when I was meant to write a one-shot fluffy smutty fic and ended up: Writing a multichapter. Constantly referencing the map...
caption:
Me when I was meant to write a one-shot fluffy smutty fic and ended up:

  • Writing a multichapter.
  • Constantly referencing the map of Westeros.
  • Googling: “How long does it take to get from King’s Landing to Winterfell/Dorne/Storm’s End by horse/boat?
  • Researching the bannermen of each great house.
  • What do people eat in ASOIAF?
  • Researching marriage ceremonies in Westeros and Essos.
  • Looking up medieval names.
  • Making diagrams of what I already established in previous chapters.
  • Looking back to that map of Westeros.

body:
can i just say i love that the hound was totally in on gendrya like gendry simply asked where arya was and he was like

you can still smell the burning bodies and you’re thinking about that👀👀👅👅👅🍆🍆🍑🍑💦💦💦💦

and gendry was like yeah what about it, there was no questions or confusion that arya and gendry were doing the devils tango
